Today is the last day to vote! Return your ballot or vote in-person by 7pm tonight! Robocalls/texts with incorrect election info have been reported across the c...ountry, though very limited numbers reported in Colorado. Visit http://GoVoteColorado.gov for correct election information. #FactsAreBetter

items.title: If you think you've encountered voter disinformation...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

If you think you've encountered voter disinformation online, screenshot and report to https://reportdisinfo.org/. Do not reply or share voting misinformation ‚Äî even if you are debunking. The more engagements, the more users will see it.

Voter disinformation can look like posts or content with false information on deadlines, dates, voting location, and voter eligibility, especially when in an aggressive tone or when threatening prosecution. For more tips on how to best report voter disinformation, visit https://reportdisinfo.org/

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Colorado voters with disabilities, you have the right to access...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Colorado voters with disabilities, you have the right to access in-person accommodations

‚óè Each polling place is required to be accessible to persons with disabilities.
‚óè If you are unable to sign your name, you have the right to vote without signing your name.
‚óè If you are a voter with Visual Impairments, you are entitled to a ballot that your assistive technology can read. ...
‚óè If you cannot read, see, or operate the voting machine because of a disability, you have the right to receive assistance from any individual you choose, or an election official.

For more accommodation info: https://bit.ly/3ezyYeZ

See MoreIt's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Proposition 115 is intentionally confusing and aims to ban...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Proposition 115 is intentionally confusing and aims to ban abortion later in pregnancy with no exceptions for health or individual circumstances. Read more about one family's heartbreaking story and vote #NoOn115 [

https://aclu-co.org/no-on-115-one-familys-story/

items.title: REMINDER: If you're visiting a polling place in person...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

REMINDER: If you're visiting a polling place in person today, clothing and accessories with political messages on them are not allowed. This includes pins, t-shirts, hats, or other apparel that display a candidate or any issue on the ballot.

You have the right to vote free of intimidation or coercion.

For voting help, call or text the Election Protection Hotline: 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683).

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: If you are voting in-person and your voting eligibility is being...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

If you are voting in-person and your voting eligibility is being challenged or you forgot your ID, you have the right to cast a provisional ballot. Provisional ballots ensure that every qualified and registered voter can cast a vote that will be counted. You will fill out an affidavit and receive a receipt with instructions on how to follow-up on your ballot status.

Report issues to 1-866-OUR-VOTE or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA.

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Know your rights. You have the right to vote free of...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Know your rights. You have the right to vote free of intimidation or interference. If you suspect voter intimidation:

‚úÖ Prioritize your own safety
‚úÖ Document the incident with as much detail as possible
‚úÖ Report to 1-866-OUR-VOTE or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA, your county clerk, and voting@aclu-co.org

Find your county clerk: https://www.sos.state.co.us/‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶/CountyClerkRosterWebsite.pdf

items.title: The election isn't over on Election night. Election results...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

The election isn't over on Election night. Election results are final when every vote is counted. Results called on Election night are only projections. Each state has specific laws that govern the counting process procedures and timelines.

Mail ballots go through a rigorous screening process to ensure election integrity. This process should not be rushed or politicized. A complete and accurate count is more important than a fast ballot count.

Check with your state and county officials for real results. https://www.sos.state.co.us/voter/pages/pub/home.xhtml

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Es un delito federal intimidar, amenazar o obligar a otra...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Es un delito federal intimidar, amenazar o obligar a otra persona con el fin de interferir con el derecho de esa persona a votar o elegir a cierta persona. La intimidaci√≥n de votantes puede ocurrir en cualquier lugar, no solo cerca de un lugar de votaci√≥n. No importa d√≥nde suceda, documente y reporte la intimidaci√≥n de votantes a sus funcionarios electos locales: https://bit.ly/3kvW748 y llame al 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683) o al 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA (1-888-839-8682)

It is a federal crime to intimidate, threaten, or force another person in order to interfere with that person's right to vote or elect a certain person. Voter bullying can happen anywhere, not just near a polling location. No matter where it happens, document and report voter intimidation to your local elected officials: https://bit.ly/3kvW748 and call 1-866-OUR-VOTE (1-866-687-8683) or 1-888-VE-Y-VOTE (1-888-839-8682 ))TranslatedIt's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Election Day is tomorrow. Here are three things you can do to...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Election Day is tomorrow. Here are three things you can do to help others vote.
üó≥Ô∏è Coloradans can turn in up to 10 ballots in a general election on behalf of others. Ballots must be returned to a drop box the same day they are collected. Take a video of your ballot delivery so the person you're helping can rest easy.
üó≥Ô∏è Know your voting rights and share with others: https://www.aclu.org/know-your-rights/voting-rights/
üó≥Ô∏è Share the voter protection hotline to report voter suppression: 1-866-OUR-VOTE and 1-888-VE-Y-VOTA.

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info

items.title: Election Day is tomorrow! Here are three things to do if you...
items.content_html:
ACLU of Colorado

Election Day is tomorrow! Here are three things to do if you haven't voted yet:

üó≥Ô∏èVote in-person: You can register the same day and receive voting assistance at a polling place near you.
üó≥Ô∏èFind your nearest ballot drop box, drive-through or in-person voting location at: https://justvotecolorado.org/.
üó≥Ô∏èUse the ACLU voter guide to help you navigate statewide ballot questions: aclu-co.org/voterguide

It's Election Day. Go to the Voting Information Center for important info and updates. Get Election Day Info
